questions.explanation:
7. There's a meeting in the conference room soon, right?
(A) Yes, it's for the whole department. → Correct (confirms the meeting and provides details)
(B) No, put it in the closet. → Incorrect (unrelated to the meeting)
(C) The rent is too high. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

8. Why hasn't the mural in the lobby been painted yet?
(A) Red and yellow. → Incorrect (refers to colors, not the reason)
(B) Please pick up the ladder. → Incorrect (unrelated to the mural's status)
(C) Because the artist is out of town. → Correct (explains why the mural isn't painted)

9. Do you prefer writing in the morning or the afternoon?
(A) My publisher requested edits. → Incorrect (unrelated to writing time preference)
(B) Thanks for providing a solution. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
(C) Mornings are usually better for me. → Correct (states a time preference)

10. I suggest we paint the waiting room light blue.
(A) Doctor Park has an opening at three. → Incorrect (unrelated to painting)
(B) That's a good idea. → Correct (agrees with the suggestion)
(C) I prefer the red jacket. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the waiting room)

11. Did you know that the music school is closed on Sundays?
(A) Forty dollars an hour. → Incorrect (refers to cost, not closure)
(B) No, I didn't know that. → Correct (acknowledges the closure information)
(C) I saw the piano recital. → Incorrect (unrelated to Sunday closure)

12. How do I find the office manager?
(A) The receptionist would know. → Correct (provides guidance on finding the manager)
(B) Desk lamps and headsets. → Incorrect (unrelated to finding the manager)
(C) Twelve euros. → Incorrect (refers to cost, not location)

13. When did you place the order for the lumber?
(A) Yes, it's a great place for hiking. → Incorrect (unrelated to the order)
(B) It's out of stock right now. → Correct (implies status of the order)
(C) The warehouse on William Street. → Incorrect (refers to location, not timing)

14. Where is the new packaging machine?
(A) Ten packages a minute. → Incorrect (refers to capacity, not location)
(B) We met last Thursday. → Incorrect (unrelated to the machine)
(C) We decided to keep the old one. → Correct (implies no new machine location)

15. I'll be out of the office this afternoon.
(A) An awfully long commute. → Incorrect (unrelated to schedule update)
(B) OK-I'll update your schedule. → Correct (acknowledges and acts on the information)
(C) It's right down the hallway. → Incorrect (refers to location, not absence)

16. Are you taking a vacation once this project is over?
(A) Yes-I'm planning a trip to Barcelona. → Correct (confirms vacation plans)
(B) This is your second time, isn't it? → Incorrect (unrelated to vacation plans)
(C) Blueprints for a high-rise building. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

17. Let's post the sales report to our team's Web page.
(A) We're sharing a taxi to the airport. → Incorrect (unrelated to posting the report)
(B) I can do that. → Correct (agrees to post the report)
(C) A recent hiring decision. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the report)

18. Which airline are you planning on using?
(A) The usual one. → Correct (specifies the airline choice)
(B) A one-way ticket. → Incorrect (refers to ticket type, not airline)
(C) Yes, you can use mine. → Incorrect (unrelated to airline choice)

19. Where's this shipment of parts being sent?
(A) Around five thirty this evening. → Incorrect (refers to time, not destination)
(B) To the assembly plant in Dublin. → Correct (specifies the shipment destination)
(C) Just half the order. → Incorrect (refers to quantity, not destination)

20. Who paid for lunch?
(A) I just ate. → Incorrect (unrelated to who paid)
(B) It closes at five. → Incorrect (refers to time, not payment)
(C) Alberto did. → Correct (identifies who paid for lunch)

21. How many employees work in your department?
(A) I don't mind taking notes at the meeting. → Incorrect (unrelated to employee count)
(B) A couple dozen, I think. → Correct (provides an estimate of employees)
(C) It's seven meters long. → Incorrect (refers to length, not employees)

22. We should leave for our training course soon, shouldn't we?
(A) We still have a few minutes. → Correct (addresses the timing of departure)
(B) There's a map on the wall. → Incorrect (refers to location, not timing)
(C) Two sessions per day. → Incorrect (refers to course schedule, not departure)

23. Isn't there a limit on travel expenses?
(A) To fix the vending machine. → Incorrect (unrelated to travel expenses)
(B) One hundred dollars per day. → Correct (specifies the expense limit)
(C) Next to the travel agency. → Incorrect (refers to location, not limit)

24. When should I tell the director that I'm interested in the management position?
(A) Yes, we're extending our business hours. → Incorrect (unrelated to the management position)
(B) Didn't Andrey direct the play? → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
(C) I'm not on the hiring team. → Correct (implies guidance on who to contact)

25. The layout of the footwear department has changed.
(A) There's a charging station in the café. → Incorrect (unrelated to department layout)
(B) Yes, a three-bedroom apartment. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the store)
(C) The store has a new manager. → Correct (implies a reason for the layout change)

26. Can you look at this month's revenue report?
(A) The news program is informative. → Incorrect (unrelated to the revenue report)
(B) I have some free time tomorrow afternoon. → Correct (agrees to review the report)
(C) He started that position in July. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the report)

27. Why haven't the windows been replaced yet?
(A) Not too much wind, no. → Incorrect (unrelated to window replacement)
(B) Look in the filing cabinet. → Incorrect (refers to location, not reason)
(C) Did you see the cost estimate? → Correct (implies a reason for delay)

28. Isn't your suitcase going to be heavier than the permitted weight?
(A) The building permit arrived today. → Incorrect (unrelated to suitcase weight)
(B) There are seats in the lobby. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
(C) I'll have to pay a little bit extra. → Correct (addresses the weight issue)

29. Who manufactures the engines for our machines?
(A) Koji is in charge of supplier contracts. → Correct (points to the person who knows the manufacturer)
(B) I'm sorry-the storage room is full. → Incorrect (unrelated to engine manufacturing)
(C) That's a cargo airplane. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

30. Should we meet at the department store on Fifth Street or the one on Grover Lane?
(A) Let's ask Patricia first. → Correct (suggests consulting someone to decide)
(B) No, I don't mind. → Incorrect (does not specify a location)
(C) How much does it cost? → Incorrect (unrelated to meeting location)

31. Which band is playing at the club tonight?
(A) There's always a comedy show on Thursday nights. → Incorrect (refers to a different event)
(B) Yes, I've played the piano for many years. → Incorrect (unrelated to the band)
(C) Their number one hit. → Correct (implies the band is known, answering indirectly)
